programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick arrests Leclerc and issues a proclamation he'll be shot if the stolen Gestapo money is not returned, while Edith is in a romantic mood and Fanny decides to bake a potato.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene narrowly escapes 258 exploding Christmas puddings and quickly becomes embroiled in another daring plot proposed by Michelle and the Resistance.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Racegoers head to two major meetings at Newbury Racecourse, with the company sending staff to a usually unmanned station to help keep things running smoothly. Paddington controller Dave Turner ensures that the correct train arrives at the intended platform at the right time, and the emergency services are called into action at the Penzance depot.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: The small, picturesque seaside station at Dawlish in Devon is brought to life by an influx of people attending an air show, and the company lays on extra staff, schedules more trains and employs different queuing systems to cope with all the passengers. At Bath Spa, gate-line operator Peter Eagle tries his hand at foreign languages as he directs international tourists to and from the ancient city.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Bruce Parkin steps off a train with his family to attend his retirement party after 52 years' service, making him one of Europe's longest-serving drivers. The redevelopment of Reading station is the largest overhaul on the Great Western network since the days of Brunel, and Murray Parkin and his team carry out the last engine change at the historic Cow Lane site before they head over to their new state-of-the-art terminal.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: A major service disruption hits Paddington on Meet the Manager day, and there is a look at Brunel's last engineering masterpiece, the Royal Albert Bridge, which spans the River Tamar and connects Devon and Cornwall. A fitter has to repair a faulty peak-time train full of passengers, and Charlbury station prepares for the Wilderness festival.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: The return of the documentary following the work of the train operating company's staff along the route between London, south-west England and south Wales. The first edition focuses on problems caused by last winter's storms, with the worst weather for a century battering the nation and pushing employees and passengers to the limit. Network Rail's Steve Hawkins and his engineers have their work cut out after the line at Dawlish in Devon is washed away, while Dave Slater and his team at Network Control have to battle the elements to keep trains running as storm after storm floods the network.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: As rugby union's Six Nations Championship kicks off in Cardiff, train manager Jodie Edwards and her team try to get thousands of fans home after the match. Penzance in Cornwall remains shut off from the rest of the network as engineers work around the clock to get services running through Dawlish, where the line was washed away, while new duty manager Joe has his hands full on his first Saturday night shift at London's Paddington station when the last Wales-bound train of the evening has a problem.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Cheltenham Spa station manager Richard Morrish braces himself for a hectic four days with the two-platform station used by more than 60,000 horse racing fans during the Cheltenham Festival. Just as the mainline at Dawlish is about to be reopened after being washed away in the winter storms, a crack is discovered in the sandstone cliffs two miles down the line and a landslide threatens to engulf the tracks. Conductor Jameil and driver Gary have to react quickly on the Reading to Gatwick service when a pedestrian takes a perilous short cut.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: As the deadline approaches for the reopening of the mainline at Dawlish, a 300-strong army of engineers works 24 hours a day to keep to the timetable. At London's Paddington station, a train with a Pullman silver service dining car is being prepared, with the onboard team pulling out all the stops to impress food writer Regula Ysewijn, who is researching an article. Elsewhere, North Cotswolds station manager Theresa - known as the 'smiling tiger' for the way she runs her stations firmly and with great care and dedication - keeps a watchful eye on the line between Oxford and Hereford, which carries the highest proportion of first-class ticket holders on the network.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The spacecraft designed for the first manned mission to Mars, planned to launch by 2035, which requires the most powerful rocket ever built and a specially designed crew module.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to buy a new suit until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel persuades him to. He agrees, but only if I can be made in the same style as his old one. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
